comments.html:
Simply put; NO.

I'm working in an SP, and we will never accept to receive a /32 route except for the RTBH.
comments.name: Mohamed Kamal

comments.html: Another option would be to use BGP deaggregation, in Cisco the feature for this is Conditional Route Injection. For this you need a longer prefix in order to inject the host or a more specific prefix (it also works to create a copy with the same length of the original prefix). Sometimes might be useful in MPLS/VPN networks.
comments.name: José Jara
